title: Is it still illegal for an attorney to charge up front fees for a loan modification?
question: I was told by a debt relief company that the ban on up front fees expired on January 1, 2013 and they want me to pay $2500 retainer fee. Is this legal or not?
answers:

SB94 is a law that carves out a small exception for attorneys. There was no law that passed that changed SB94. The law that went into effect on January 1st 2013 was SB900 which provides protection to homeowners dealing with the banks.

SB94 requires attorneys to completed everything contracted for prior to collection of fees. From the limited information you gave, this retainer sounds suspicious.

I am confused by your question. In the title you refer to paying an attorney for assistance. But, in the body you mention a debt relief company. So, you might want to repost your question with more specifics.
